result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allan R. Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Portage County DNA Proof of Submission - original filed in 15CT271

Defendant Allan R. Miller in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CT271, 16CM150 & 16TR550.

10:30 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CT271:
Count 1 - No contest 

16CM150:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

16TR550:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CT271 and Count 1 & 2 in 16CM150 are DRI and Count 1 in 16TR550 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CT271:
Count 1 -
Jail sentence for 30 days with huber priveleges
Jail sentence to be served on electronic home monitor, to be transferred to Wood County if accepted.
Jail sentence to be transferred to Wood County, if approved
Sentence to commence within 60 days
Report to jail today for start date
Pay $250 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up a payment plan
Provide DNA sample

16CM150:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

16TR550:
Count 1 - DRI

Atty Knaapen makes statements in regards to the Order for IID and that this case does not have a need for an IID.
Atty Drengler makes his statement as to the reasons why it was requested.
BTC:  Court signs the order
/s/RJS Plea/sentencing hrg set. Original filed in 15CT-271.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Prior: 485 2nd Street S, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494
Pre-trial conference on May 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Comply with conditions of bond in 15CT271.

Defendant Allan R. Miller in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: Initial appearances - 16CM150, 16TR550  Warrant appearance - 09FO47

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant indicates he has an attorney on other charges.  
BY THE COURT: Court orders the defendant to make application at the public defender's office. 

Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

09FO47 - 
Court reviews the file. 
Court verifies the defendant's date of birth. 
Court advises the defendant of charges. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.  

Defendant enters NOT GUILTY plea. 
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the not guilty plea.  Court quashes the warrant. 

16TR550:
Court informs the defendant of charges. 
Matter will track with other cases. 
Bond is continued in this file.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.
